item.title: Re: Van Richten's Guide to Ravenloft
item.content:encoded:
the Sword Coast Investigator is in a weird spot where it's both setting specific and a variant of another background. we've generally agreed that the SCAG backgrounds fit with common backgrounds since they're easily applicable to most settings if you ignore flavor-text, so I think a solution may be to either

a) make a new category called Variants under which we can link to background variants like the PHB's gladiator, pirate, and spy as well as SCAG's investigator and any other variant backgrounds, or
b) list variants next to their source background like "City Watch / Investigator".

honestly, WOTC made this more difficult than it needs to be by naming another official background "Investigator", and the easiest solution would probably be to just add (SCAG) or (VRGR) next to the investigator backgrounds. hopefully they don't make a habit of naming different options the same thing, otherwise that'll be very annoying to deal with moving forwards

Yeah, thats correct. The optional background features essentially let you chose any of the other backgrounds but replace their feature (i.e., the sage having the ability to know where to find information) with another feature, such as the under dark ones letting you travel the underdark safely

So the optional background features aren't tied to a specific background but are available to any/all?

item.title: Re: Van Richten's Guide to Ravenloft
item.content:encoded:
Nice work with the lineages

Yeah, I could make a trinkets page. It wouldnt be too difficult, probably just a few tables essentially

Dark gifts kinda go with the general discussion of misc things, so once we kinda work out what to do with epic boons, charms, and other such player aquirable features that dont fit into items and feats.

The optional background features include
Inheritor (as in, inheriting a legacy. Depending on the reputation and awareness of said legacy you can shift around public opinion with you),
Mist wanderer (More setting specific, but it lets you recognize Mist Talismens from the domains of dread),
Spirit medium (Advantage on knowledge checks regarding spirits and the afterlife. You also get a free divination tool such as a tarroka deck or ouija board which you are proficient in, allowing you to divine information),
Trauma survivor (Your character is generally knowledgable in how to avoid said circumstances and recover from dangerous ones. People are also generally sympathetic to you)
Traveler (Similiar to other 'You can find shelter among locals' background features, with the additional ability to instantly recognize if an object is from your place of origin)

Hm, however, I do believe we'd need to work out something new for optional background features. Perhaps a page thats part of the backgrounds section titled just 'Alternate Background Features' which has all the features within

Ah! Seperate thing, but Survivors! Survivors are mini classes/statblocks that are designed for players to use, similiar to sidekicks, and designed kinda with the idea in mind that the characters will probably die. Im creating a page for them, but yeah, its interesting to note that survivors and sidekicks exist in a similiar place in terms of miscellany
